title: Seffa (Sweet Vermicelli with Cinnamon and Almonds)
description: A celebratory sweet couscous or vermicelli dish flavored with cinnamon, sugar, and butter, traditionally served at special occasions.
instructions: If using vermicelli, break into 2-inch pieces. If using couscous, place in a large bowl.
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large pan and toast vermicelli until golden (skip if using couscous).
Pour boiling water over vermicelli/couscous, add 1 tsp salt, and let sit covered for 10 minutes.
While grains hydrate, toast almonds in a dry pan until golden. Set aside.
Soak raisins in warm water with 1 tbsp orange blossom water for 15 minutes, then drain.
Fluff vermicelli/couscous with a fork, breaking up any lumps.
In a large steamer or couscoussier, steam the grains over boiling water for 20 minutes.
Return steamed grains to large bowl and mix in 100g melted butter, remaining orange blossom water, and sugar. Mix gently with forks.
Steam again for another 15 minutes until very fluffy.
To serve: Mound the seffa on a large platter. Make decorative patterns with ground cinnamon on top.
Sprinkle with toasted almonds and drained raisins.
Dust with powdered sugar and drizzle with remaining melted butter.
Serve warm as a sweet main course or dessert.
